meanings.definition: Having higher moral qualities; superior in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: She always chooses the nobler path, even when it's difficult.
meanings.sent2: The hero's actions were nobler than anyone else's in the story.
meanings.sent3: It's nobler to admit your mistake and apologize than to pretend it never happened.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of deceit, her honesty shone like a nobler beacon.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dedication to helping her students succeed was a nobler example for all.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the nobility or aristocracy.
meanings.sent1: The nobler families in the kingdom were known for their grand estates.
meanings.sent2: The nobler titles were passed down through generations in the royal family.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed to have a nobler air when sitting on the velvet cushion.
meanings.sent4: The grand chandelier in the ballroom cast a nobler light on the dancers below.
meanings.sent5: The nobler attire of the nobility stood out among the common folk at the event.
